Honestly one of the greatest games i have ever played, the world is so unbelievably immersive,  the characters are fantastic, the game play is so addicting, i'm so glad that there's a level creation and sharing system on this game, because without it, i might have to raid Valve's offices and get them to make Portal 3 once the Steam Deck is out.

Portal 2 is the best puzzle game i have ever played, the gameplay is amazing, the story is very interesting, the characters are some of the best ever created and the map design is just perfect. But one of the best parts of this masterpiece is the perpetual testing initiative, with it you can play amazing custom maps created by the community, made using hammer, BEE2 or even the default editor, the creativity of some creators are limitless, making even entire campaigns with insane amounts of detail. And the co-op?, amazing!, if you have a friend who owns portal 2, go play with them this instant!!, solving the puzzles or even just joking around is very fun.

Portal 2 is a game in which there is a cannon that opens an entrance and exit at any point in space, there is a series of sterile rooms where it is necessary to solve puzzles with the help of this cannon. Quite fascinating

Ğ½Ñƒ Ñ‚ÑƒÑ‚ ĞºĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğµ Ñ‡ĞµÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ´Ğ¾ Ñ Ñ…Ğ·

I'm a massive fan of the original Portal, and I'd argue it's as close to technical perfection in game design as is possible. That being said, Portal 2 has a number of things going for it. It's far more visually interesting, the story is deeper, and the characters are three dimensional. New mechanics help the gameplay stay engaging, and the level editor greatly extends the replay value.

All that being said, some of the charm of the original is lost here. You won't get to know the game as intimately, because it's longer and less compact.

Portal 2 is not the same game as the original Portal. It shares some of the same mechanics and characters, but it's not a clone. This is good - but following up perfection is a difficult job.
